title: Brine Shrimp Claim Supported by Data

content.description:
The table below shows the number of brine shrimp that hatched over 72 hours in three different concentrations of salt water. All tanks had 50 eggs at the start of the study.
 Number of Brine Shrimp Hatched Sodium Chloride Concentration 0 hours 12 hours 24 hours 48 hours 72 hours <math alttext="0 milligrams per 100 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac bevelled="true"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ml</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 0 0 0 1 2 <math alttext="10 milligrams per 100 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac bevelled="true"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ml</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> 0 0 7 15 16 <math alttext="20 milligrams per 100 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac bevelled="true"><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ml</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 0 3 14 29 34 <math alttext="30 milligrams per 100 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac bevelled="true"><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ml</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 0 7 28 40 42
content.question: Which of the following claims about brine shrimp is best supported by the data in the table?

choices.label: Brine shrimp generally hatch in 36 to 48 hours in warm temperatures.
The growth and survival of brine shrimp are optimal 72 hours after hatching.

There is more food available for brine shrimp when the water has a salt concentration of <math alttext="20 milligrams per 100 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The optimal salinity for brine shrimp hatching is <math alttext="30 milligrams per 100 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The optimal salinity for brine shrimp hatching is <math alttext="30 milligrams per 100 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 5.E: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about environmental issues.
